bill.title: Guardianship; Gun Control
bill.description: Requires the courts to provide information relating to adult guardianships to the Hawaii criminal justice data center to disclose to the Federal Bureau of Investigation National Instant Criminal Background Check System database for gun control purposes. Requires the Hawaii criminal justice data center to maintain orders of appointment or information from orders of appointment for use in firearms permitting and registration. Takes effect January 1, 2017. (SD1)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Introduced.
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, JDL.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 02-11-16 1:15PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in PSM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Espero, Inouye; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Baker, Slom.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2219) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JDL.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL will hold a public decision making on 03-01-16 9:05AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in JDL were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, L. Thielen, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Gabbard, K.Kahele, Kim.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2689) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading.
One Day Notice 03-08-16.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading. Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Riviere). Transmitted to House.
Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 262) in amended form (SD 1).
Pass First Reading
Referred to JUD, referral sheet 26
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 03-29-16 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, San Buenaventura, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, Kawakami, Morikawa, Nakashima, Takayama, Woodson; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, C. Lee, McDermott, Thielen.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1450-16), recommending passage on Second Reading and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Passed Second Reading; placed on the calendar for Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Choy, Ichiyama, Rhoads, Souki, Tokioka excused (5).

Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Fukumoto Chang, Kong, Matsumoto, McDermott, Tupola voting no (5) and Representative(s) Cachola, McKelvey, Oshiro, Rhoads, Thielen, Ward excused (6). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 382).
Enrolled to Governor.
